verses.verse: He that is wounded in the stones <WH6481>, or has his privy member <WH8212> cut off <WH3772>, shall not enter <WH935> into the congregation <WH6951> of the Lord <WH3068>.

A bastard <WH4464> shall not enter <WH935> into the congregation <WH6951> of the Lord <WH3068>; even to his tenth <WH6224> generation <WH1755> shall he not enter <WH935> into the congregation <WH6951> of the Lord <WH3068>.

An Ammonite <WH5984> or Moabite <WH4125> shall not enter <WH935> into the congregation <WH6951> of the Lord <WH3068>; even to their tenth <WH6224> generation <WH1755> shall they not enter <WH935> into the congregation <WH6951> of the Lord <WH3068> for <WH5704> ever <WH5769>:

Because <WH1697> they met <WH6923> you not with bread <WH3899> and with water <WH4325> in the way <WH1870>, when you came forth <WH3318> out of Egypt <WH4714>; and because they hired <WH7936> against you Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> of Pethor <WH6604> of Mesopotamia <WH763>, to curse you <WH7043>.

Nevertheless the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> would <WH14> not listen <WH8085> unto Balaam <WH1109>; but the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> turned <WH2015> the curse <WH7045> into a blessing <WH1293> unto you <WH3068>, because the Lord your God <WH430> loved you <WH157>.
You shall not seek <WH1875> their peace <WH7965> nor their prosperity <WH2896> all your days <WH3117> for ever <WH5769>.
You shall not abhor <WH8581> an Edomite <WH130>; for he is your brother <WH251>: you shall not abhor <WH8581> an Egyptian <WH4713>; because you were a stranger <WH1616> in his land <WH776>.
The sons <WH1121> that are fathered <WH3205> of them shall enter <WH935> into the congregation <WH6951> of the Lord <WH3068> in their third <WH7992> generation <WH1755>.
When the host <WH4264> goes forth <WH3318> against your enemies <WH341>, then keep <WH8104> you from every wicked <WH7451> thing <WH1697>.

If there be among you any man <WH376>, that is not clean <WH2889> by reason of uncleanness that chances <WH7137> him by night <WH3915>, then shall he go <WH3318> abroad <WH2351> out of the camp <WH4264>, he shall not come <WH935> inside <WH8432> the camp <WH4264>:

But it shall be <WH6153>, when evening comes on <WH6437>, he shall wash <WH7364> himself with water <WH4325>: and when the sun <WH8121> is down <WH935>, he shall come <WH935> into <WH8432> the camp again <WH4264>.
You shall have a place also <WH3027> outside <WH2351> the camp <WH4264>, where you shall go forth <WH3318> abroad <WH2351>:

And you shall have a paddle <WH3489> among your weapons <WH240>; and it shall be <WH3427>, when you will ease yourself abroad <WH2351>, you shall dig <WH2658> with it <WH7725>, and shall turn back and cover <WH3680> that which comes from you <WH6627>:

For the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> walks <WH1980> in the middle <WH7130> of your camp <WH4264>, to deliver <WH5337> you <WH5414>, and to give up your enemies <WH341> before <WH6440> you <WH4264>; therefore shall your camp be holy <WH6918>: that he see <WH7200> no unclean <WH6172> thing <WH1697> in you <WH7725>, and turn away from you <WH310>.
You shall not deliver <WH5462> unto his master <WH113> the servant <WH5650> which is escaped <WH5337> from his master unto you <WH113>:

He shall live <WH3427> with you <WH7130>, even among you <WH4725>, in that place which he shall choose <WH977> in one <WH259> of your gates <WH8179>, where it pleases him best <WH2896>: you shall not oppress him <WH3238>.
There shall be no whore <WH6948> of the daughters <WH1323> of Israel <WH3478>, nor a sodomite <WH6945> of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.

You shall not bring <WH935> the hire <WH868> of a whore <WH2181>, or the price <WH4242> of a dog <WH3611>, into the house <WH1004> of the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> for any vow <WH5088>: for even both <WH8147> these are abomination <WH8441> unto the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>.

You shall not lend upon usury <WH5391> to your brother <WH251>; usury <WH5392> of money <WH3701>, usury <WH5392> of food <WH400>, usury <WH5392> of any thing <WH1697> that is lent upon usury <WH5391>:

Unto a stranger <WH5237> you may lend upon usury <WH5391>; but unto your brother <WH251> you shall not lend upon usury <WH5391>: that the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> may bless <WH1288> you in all that you settest <WH4916> your hand <WH3027> to in the land <WH776> where you go <WH935> to possess it <WH3423>.

When you shall vow <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> unto the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>, you shall not slack <WH309> to pay <WH7999> it <WH3068>: for the Lord your God <WH430> will surely <WH1875> require <WH1875> it of you <WH2399>; and it would be sin in you.
But if you shall forbear <WH2308> to vow <WH5087>, it shall be no sin in you <WH2399>.

That which is gone out <WH4161> of your lips <WH8193> you shall keep <WH8104> and perform <WH6213>; even a freewill offering <WH5071>, according as you have vowed <WH5087> unto the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430>, which you have promised <WH1696> with your mouth <WH6310>.

When you come <WH935> into your neighbour <WH7453>'s vineyard <WH3754>, then you may eat <WH398> grapes <WH6025> your fill <WH7648> at your own pleasure <WH5315>; but you shall not put <WH5414> any in your vessel <WH3627>.

When you come <WH935> into the standing corn <WH7054> of your neighbor <WH7453>, then you may pluck <WH6998> the ears <WH4425> with your hand <WH3027>; but you shall not move <WH5130> a sickle <WH2770> unto your neighbour <WH7453>'s standing corn <WH7054>.
